attributes.action: Allow Julian Assange to leave the Ecuadorean Embassy without threat of arrest.
attributes.additional_details: We the people are demanding that the UK government abide by the UN ruling. The UN has made a very clear ruling.The UK (and Sweden) are bound by the U.N. Convention on Civil and Political Rights. And it is now for them to find a way of complying.
attributes.background: A United Nations panel has officially concluded WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange has been "arbitrarily detained" and should be allowed to walk free. Assange has been holed up in Ecuadorean Embassy in London for more than three years.
